 20/// Helper class to help project a domain: create a lower-dimensional
 21/// domain from an existing domain.
 22template <dimension_type D>
 23struct Project_domain;
 24
 25/// Specialization for projecting to a 1-dimensional domain.
 26template <>
 27struct Project_domain<1>
 28{
 29  template <dimension_type D>
 30  static Domain<1> project(Domain<D> const& dom)
 31  {
 32    assert(1 <= D);
 33    return Domain<1>(dom[0]);
 34  }
 35};
 36
 37/// Specialization for projecting to a 2-dimensional domain.
 38template <>
 39struct Project_domain<2>
 40{
 41  template <dimension_type D>
 42  static Domain<2> project(Domain<D> const& dom)
 43  {
 44    assert(2 <= D);
 45    return Domain<2>(dom[0], dom[1]);
 46  }
 47};
 48
 49/// Specialization for projecting to a 3-dimensional domain.
 50template <>
 51struct Project_domain<3>
 52{
 53  template <dimension_type D>
 54  static Domain<3> project(Domain<D> const& dom)
 55  {
 56    assert(3 <= D);
 57    return dom;
 58  }
 59};
 60
 61template <dimension_type D, typename BlockT>
 62struct Block_domain_class;
 63
 64template <typename BlockT>
 65struct Block_domain_class<1, BlockT>
 66{
 67  static Domain<1> func(BlockT const& block)
 68  { return Domain<1>(block.size(1, 0));}
 69};
 70
 71template <typename BlockT>
 72struct Block_domain_class<2, BlockT>
 73{
 74  static Domain<2> func(BlockT const& block)
 75  { return Domain<2>(block.size(2, 0), block.size(2, 1));}
 76};
 77
 78template <typename BlockT>
 79struct Block_domain_class<3, BlockT>
 80{
 81  static Domain<3> func(BlockT const& block)
 82  { return Domain<3>(block.size(3, 0), block.size(3, 1), block.size(3, 2)); }
 83};
 84
 85} // namespace domain_utils;
 86
 87/// Project an ORIGDIM-dimension domain to PROJDIM dimensions.
 88/// (where PROJDIM <= ORIGDIM)
 89template <dimension_type ProjDim, dimension_type OrigDim>
 90Domain<ProjDim>
 91project(Domain<OrigDim> const& dom)
 92{
 93  return domain_utils::Project_domain<ProjDim>::project(dom);
 94}
 95
 96/// Construct a Domain<D> from an array of Dim Domain<1>s.
 97template <dimension_type D>
 98Domain<D>
 99construct_domain(Domain<1> const *dom);
100
101/// Specialization to constuct a Domain<1>.
102template <>
103inline Domain<1>
104construct_domain(Domain<1> const *dom) { return dom[0];}
105
106/// Specialization to constuct a Domain<2>.
107template <>
108inline Domain<2>
109construct_domain(Domain<1> const *dom) { return Domain<2>(dom[0], dom[1]);}
110
111/// Specialization to constuct a Domain<3>.
112template <>
113inline Domain<3>
114construct_domain(Domain<1> const *dom)
115{ return Domain<3>(dom[0], dom[1], dom[2]);}
116
117/// Compute interstection of two 1-D domains.
118/// Arguments:
119///
120///   :dom1: is a Domain<1> with stride 1,
121///   :dom2: is a Domain<1>
122///   :res:  is a Domain<1>.
123///
124/// Effects:
125///
126///   If dom1 and dom2 intersect, Interstection is placed in res and
127///   true is returned. Otherwise, res is unchanged and false is returned.
128inline bool
129intersect(Domain<1> const &dom1,
130	  Domain<1> const &dom2,
131	  Domain<1> &res)
132{
133  assert(dom1.stride() == 1);
134
135  if (dom2.stride() == 1)
136  {
137    index_type first   = std::max(dom1.first(),     dom2.first());
138    index_type last    = std::min(dom1.impl_last(), dom2.impl_last());
139
140    if (first <= last) 
141    {
142      res = Domain<1>(first, 1, last-first+1);
143      return true;
144    }
145    else return false;
146  }
147  else
148  {
149    index_type first1  = dom1.first();
150    index_type first2  = dom2.first();
151    index_type last1   = dom1.impl_last();
152    index_type last2   = dom2.impl_last();
153    if (first2 < first1)
154    {
155      index_type diff = first1 - first2;
156      first2 += diff;
157      if (diff % dom2.stride())
158	first2 += (dom2.stride() - (diff % dom2.stride()));
159    }
160    if (last2 > last1)
161    {
162      index_type diff = last2 - last1;
163      if (diff % dom2.stride())
164	last2 -= (dom2.stride() - (diff % dom2.stride()));
165    }
166
167    index_type first   = std::max(first1, first2);
168    index_type last    = std::min(last1,  last2);
169
170    if (first <= last) 
171    {
172      res = Domain<1>(first, dom2.stride(), (last-first)/dom2.stride()+1);
173      return true;
174    }
175    else return false;
176  }
177}
178
179/// Compute interstection of two 2-D domains.
180inline bool
181intersect(Domain<2> const &dom1,
182	  Domain<2> const &dom2,
183	  Domain<2> &res)
184{
185  Domain<1> res_dim[2];
186
187  if (intersect(dom1[0], dom2[0], res_dim[0]) &&
188      intersect(dom1[1], dom2[1], res_dim[1]))
189  {
190    res = Domain<2>(res_dim[0], res_dim[1]);
191    return true;
192  }
193  else return false;
194}
195
196/// Compute interstection of two 3-D domains.
197inline bool
198intersect(Domain<3> const &dom1,
199	  Domain<3> const &dom2,
200	  Domain<3> &res)
201{
202  Domain<1> res_dim[3];
203
204  if (intersect(dom1[0], dom2[0], res_dim[0]) &&
205      intersect(dom1[1], dom2[1], res_dim[1]) &&
206      intersect(dom1[2], dom2[2], res_dim[2]))
207  {
208    res = Domain<3>(res_dim[0], res_dim[1], res_dim[2]);
209    return true;
210  }
211  else return false;
212}
213
214#if 0
215// General intersection would be possible if Domains were modifiable.
216// (Dim == 1 case would need to be specialized, of course).
217
218template <dimension_type D>
219bool
220intersect(Domain<D> const &dom1,
221	  Domain<D> const &dom2,
222	  Domain<D> &res)
223{
224  for (dimension_type d=0; d<D; ++d)
225    if (intersect(dom1[d], dom2[d], res[d]) == false)
226      return false;
227  return true;
228}
229#endif
230
231/// Apply offset implied by intersection to another domain.
232inline Domain<1>
233apply_intr(Domain<1> const &x,
234	   Domain<1> const &y,
235	   Domain<1> const &intr)
236{
237  return Domain<1>(x.first() + (intr.first() - y.first()) * x.stride(),
238		   x.stride() * intr.stride(),
239		   intr.size());
240}
241
242inline Domain<2>
243apply_intr(Domain<2> const &x,
244	   Domain<2> const &y,
245	   Domain<2> const &intr)
246{
247  return Domain<2>(apply_intr(x[0], y[0], intr[0]),
248		   apply_intr(x[1], y[1], intr[1]));
249}
250
251inline Domain<3>
252apply_intr(Domain<3> const &x,
253	   Domain<3> const &y,
254	   Domain<3> const &intr)
255{
256  return Domain<3>(apply_intr(x[0], y[0], intr[0]),
257		   apply_intr(x[1], y[1], intr[1]),
258		   apply_intr(x[2], y[2], intr[2]));
259}
260
261
262
263/// Convert an intersection into a subset
264///
265/// Subdomain's
266///
267///   :offset: is adjusted relative to parent domain
268///   :stride: is 1 (since parent encodes stride)
269///   :size: is unchanged.
270inline Domain<1>
271subset_from_intr(Domain<1> const &dom,
272		 Domain<1> const &intr)
273{
274  return Domain<1>((intr.first() - dom.first()) / dom.stride(),
275		   1,
276		   intr.size());
277}
278
279inline Domain<2>
280subset_from_intr(Domain<2> const &dom,
281		 Domain<2> const &intr)
282{
283  return Domain<2>(subset_from_intr(dom[0], intr[0]),
284		   subset_from_intr(dom[1], intr[1]));
285}
286
287inline Domain<3>
288subset_from_intr(Domain<3> const &dom,
289		 Domain<3> const &intr)
290{
291  return Domain<3>(subset_from_intr(dom[0], intr[0]),
292		   subset_from_intr(dom[1], intr[1]),
293		   subset_from_intr(dom[2], intr[2]));
294}
295
296
297
298/// Return the total size of a domain.
299template <dimension_type D>
300length_type
301size(Domain<D> const &dom)
302{
303  length_type s = 1;
304  for (dimension_type d=0; d<D; ++d)
305    s *= dom[d].length();
306  return s;
307}
308
309
310
311/// Return the domain of a block.
312template <dimension_type D, typename BlockT>
313inline Domain<D>
314block_domain(BlockT const &block)
315{
316  return domain_utils::Block_domain_class<D, BlockT>::func(block);
317}
318
319/// Return the empty domain.
320template <dimension_type D>
321Domain<D>
322empty_domain()
323{
324  Domain<1> dom[D];
325  for (dimension_type d=0; d<D; ++d)
326    dom[d] = Domain<1>(0);
327  return construct_domain<D>(dom);
328}
329
330/// Normalize a domain -- return a new domain with the same length
331/// in each dimension, but with offset = 0 and stride = 1.
332inline Domain<1>
333normalize(Domain<1> const &dom) 
334{ return Domain<1>(dom.size());}
335
336inline Domain<2>
337normalize(Domain<2> const &dom)
338{ return Domain<2>(dom[0].size(), dom[1].size());}
339
340inline Domain<3>
341normalize(Domain<3> const &dom)
342{ return Domain<3>(dom[0].size(), dom[1].size(), dom[2].size());}
343
344/// Get the nth index in a domain.
345template <dimension_type D>
346Index<D>
347domain_nth(Domain<D> const &dom, Index<D> const &idx)
348{
349  Index<D> res;
350  for (dimension_type d = 0; d < D; ++d)
351    res[d] = dom[d].impl_nth(idx[d]);
352  return res;
353}
354
355/// Get the extent of a domain as a Length.
356template <dimension_type D>
357Length<D>
358extent(Domain<D> const &dom)
359{
360  Length<D> res;
361  for (dimension_type d = 0; d < D; ++d)
362    res[d] = dom[d].length();
363  return res;
364}
365
366
367/// Get the first index of a domain.
368template <dimension_type D>
369Index<D>
370first(Domain<D> const& dom)
371{
372  Index<D> res;
373  for (dimension_type d = 0; d < D; ++d)
374    res[d] = dom[d].first();
375  return res;
376}
377
378/// Construct a 1-dim domain with a size (implicit offset of 0 and
379/// stride of 1)
380inline Domain<1>
381domain(Length<1> const &size) { return Domain<1>(size[0]);}
382
383/// Construct a 2-dim domain with a size (implicit offset of 0 and
384/// stride of 1)
385inline Domain<2>
386domain(Length<2> const &size) { return Domain<2>(size[0], size[1]);}
387
388/// Construct a 3-dim domain with a size (implicit offset of 0 and
389/// stride of 1)
390inline Domain<3>
391domain(Length<3> const &size) { return Domain<3>(size[0], size[1], size[2]);}
392
393/// Construct a 1-dim domain with an offset and a size (implicit
394/// stride of 1)
395inline Domain<1>
396domain(Index<1> const &first, Length<1> const &size)
397{ return Domain<1>(first[0], 1, size[0]);}
398
399/// Construct a 2-dim domain with an offset and a size (implicit
400/// stride of 1)
401inline Domain<2>
402domain(Index<2> const &first, Length<2> const &size)
403{
404  return Domain<2>(Domain<1>(first[0], 1, size[0]),
405		   Domain<1>(first[1], 1, size[1]));
406}
407
408/// Construct a 3-dim domain with an offset and a size (implicit
409/// stride of 1)
410inline Domain<3>
411domain(Index<3> const &first, Length<3> const &size)
412{
413  return Domain<3>(Domain<1>(first[0], 1, size[0]),
414		   Domain<1>(first[1], 1, size[1]),
415		   Domain<1>(first[2], 1, size[2]));
416}
417
418/// Return the next Index from 'idx' using OrderT to determine the
419/// dimension-ordering of the traversal.
420template <typename OrderT>
421inline Index<1>&
422next(Length<1> const &/*extent*/, Index<1> &idx)
423{
424  VSIP_IMPL_STATIC_ASSERT(OrderT::impl_dim0 == 0);
425  ++idx[OrderT::impl_dim0];
426  return idx;
427}
428
429template <typename OrderT>
430inline Index<2>&
431next(Length<2> const &extent, Index<2> &idx)
432{
433  VSIP_IMPL_STATIC_ASSERT(OrderT::impl_dim0 < 2);
434  VSIP_IMPL_STATIC_ASSERT(OrderT::impl_dim1 < 2);
435  if (++idx[OrderT::impl_dim1] == extent[OrderT::impl_dim1])
436  {
437    if (++idx[OrderT::impl_dim0] != extent[OrderT::impl_dim0])
438      idx[OrderT::impl_dim1] = 0;
439  }
440  return idx;
441}
442
443template <typename OrderT>
444inline Index<3>&
445next(Length<3> const &extent, Index<3> &idx)
446{
447  if (++idx[OrderT::impl_dim2] == extent[OrderT::impl_dim2])
448  {
449    if (++idx[OrderT::impl_dim1] == extent[OrderT::impl_dim1])
450    {
451      if (++idx[OrderT::impl_dim0] == extent[OrderT::impl_dim0])
452	return idx;
453      idx[OrderT::impl_dim1] = 0;
454    }
455    idx[OrderT::impl_dim2] = 0;
456  }
457  return idx;
458}
459
460/// Overload of next that performs row-major traversal.
461template <dimension_type D>
462inline Index<D> &
463next(Length<D> const &extent, Index<D> &idx)
464{
465  return next<typename Row_major<D>::type>(extent, idx);
466}
467
468/// This function checks if the index is valid given a certain length. This
469/// function works for multiple dimension spaces.
470template <dimension_type D>
471inline bool
472valid(Length<D> const &extent, Index<D> const &idx)
473{
474  for(dimension_type d = 0; d < D; ++d)
475    if(idx[d] >= extent[d])
476      return false;
477  return true;
478}
479
480/// Get a value from a 1-dim block.
481template <typename Block>
482inline typename Block::value_type
483get(Block const &block, Index<1> const &idx)
484{ return block.get(idx[0]);}
485
486/// Get a value from a 2-dim block.
487template <typename Block>
488inline typename Block::value_type
489get(Block const &block, Index<2> const &idx)
490{ return block.get(idx[0], idx[1]);}
491
492/// Get a value from a 3-dim block.
493template <typename Block>
494inline typename Block::value_type
495get(Block const &block, Index<3> const &idx)
496{ return block.get(idx[0], idx[1], idx[2]);}
497
498/// Put a value into a 1-dim block.
499template <typename Block>
500inline void
501put(Block &block, Index<1> const &idx,
502    typename Block::value_type const &val)
503{ block.put(idx[0], val);}
504
505/// Put a value into a 2-dim block.
506template <typename Block>
507inline void
508put(Block &block, Index<2> const &idx,
509    typename Block::value_type const &val)
510{ block.put(idx[0], idx[1], val);}
511
512template <typename Block>
513inline void
514put(Block &block, Index<3> const &idx,
515    typename Block::value_type const& val)
516{ block.put(idx[0], idx[1], idx[2], val);}
